description.narrative:
Progressive international action on livelihoods and sustainable development dictates the need to address three inter-related objectives: Address food security, while dealing with the effects of climate change that are already being felt by the poor and vulnerableespecially small scale farmers; Ensure space for Africa#s development and in support of a just transition investing in small scale farmers and in Agricultural economy and calls for a paradigm shift that supports strategies for achieving equitable development, realizing human rights, and the well-being of populations in the context of sustainable development. It is on the basis of these realities that intensified efforts by civil society and particularly small holders active participation in decision making and inclusion in policies to advocate for their interests.
It is against this backdrop that the efforts of ESSAF and its partners become more relevant since the impacts of investing in small scale agriculture and family farming will be felt at the local level and therefore theactive participation of the stakeholders at the local, regional and national levels is critical for the advancement of decisions reached through institutions and policy makers at all these levels. This reality raises the question of governance within the agricultural agenda and practices. ESSAF fills a capacity building and coordination need as small farmers increasingly feel marginalised and challenged by new agriculture trends and agribusiness for example bio fuels, carbon credit,Guided by the human rights approach in its quest to focus on women discriminated against in Africa as its main target group, AAWORD/AFARD, in its strategic Plan 2014 - 2016, will in the next three years fight against gender disparities and will continue to exert influence on the major policies and programs in Africa for significant, positive and concrete changes in the lives of women.
Contributing to the attainment of gender equality during the next three (3) years, AAWORD/AFARD will focus on economic justice and democratic governance and will also address emerging issues related to violence against women, to the impact of climate change on the health of women and their economic activitiesand gender in migration.
AAWORD/AFARD willuse its technical leadership and its position as a Think Tank to address the root causesof gender inequalities that perpetuate poverty, and advocate for political and social changes that will help transform the lives and livelihoods of women of all agesand communities in order to improve their lot. AAWORD/AFARD will not only raise awareness on development issues from a gender perspective, but also will strive for the transformation of and introduction of GMOs and seeds. This is pushing them to become organised at local level and increasingly at national level and regional level.

participating-org.narrative: AAWORD (AFARD in French) is a membership organisation and one of the very first Africa-wide networks of women. It formed in December 1977, in order to enable African women not only to shape, but also define the African feminist research that is critical in informing both policies and programs and thus contributes to realising gender equality. By 1999 AAWORD had evolved from a group of individual women to a movement of national chapters influencing policies and programs at the continental and national levels. Promoting women#s rights and needs has been an overarching strategy where all researches and advocacy intervention embraces a gender lens. However in 2007, celebrating its 30 years of existence and with chapters in 22 countries, the organisation decided to undertake a criticalself-examination. Through a remedial meeting in 2008, members, donors, the secretariat as well as old members came together to examine the current state of affairs of feminist research in Africa, the progress made but also to take stock of the problems and difficulties the organisation itself was facing. This has resulted in AAWORD#s first strategic plan and a new institutional and programmatic orientation of the secretariat and its members.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation

description.narrative: no. of cases that show how partner organisations use new tools to measure and improve the legitimacy and risk management of organisations, with a special focus on (women) organisations in countries with repression and conflict.
